vsParam:
Wow!? I heard that Sterk is training with the Guard,
but I never thought his opponent would Tandrion!?

Ha! Your attack is powerful!
I'd be dangerous if I resisted that from the front!

Hmm, you are great, too!
You see me through, huh?

You movements and speed are excellent!
But... take this!

Sterk and captain... What a wonderful duel!
Is that... the real swordsmanship!

Being able to watch such a great thing,
I feel so happy ah ah ah ah!

Leave this hot-blooded moron alone...
But I am surprised that Tandrion brings out his true strength.

After all, the opponent is a Sterk, a master,
even Tandrion must take it very seriously!
His opponent is very handsome, too!

It's a like they are performing a sword dance!
Ah... So beautiful!

Oh, the crowd is getting bigger.
Quit it! Let's just stop here today!

Uh!?
You have to finish the competition, Tandrion!

We'll settle it next time.
I can't focus in front of such a big crowd!

Right, Sterk!
Please give Cresson some guidance in actual combats.

Let's name it Sterkish Training!
I gotta go, I'll leave Cresson to you~

"Sterkish Training"?
Wait, Tandrion, our competition isn't——

I understand, captain!
I'll learn hard from Sterk!

So, sorry to trouble you, Sterk!
Please teach me the swordsmanship of Arland!

Ah, hmm... I'll teach you during
our battle with the monsters.

Oh oh, great——! Now the monsters are no match for me,
no matter it's 100 or 200 of them!

Ah... Given Cresson and Sterk's mental states now,
I'll be worried if they go out like that...

Yeah. Let's tag along, [px].
Just in case we need to stop him... I mean Cresson.

There's a suitable monster.
Make it your opponent.

But remember, this is an actual combat. Carelessness will
make you get hurt. Stay sharp before you are sure that
the battle is over.

Uh, okay!
Hmm... please give me advice!

Ha! Great, battle's over.
You've done a good job, Cresson.

Uh, thank you for your compliment!
I remembered all your movements!

Your sword was fast and powerful, and each movement
of you aimed to take its life... I'll train harder so that I could
be like you one day!

Ha-ha, look how excited Cresson is.
He's so happy...

You guys provided reliable support for him.
Good teamwork.

Hee hee, thank you!
I am very happy to hear your compliment!
Yes. But... hmm, this is really a tiring job for you. Thank you.

Tandrion did things without thinking,
and put you through this training he casually mentioned...
Hmm, you are not angry, are you?
I'll give you a shoulder massage later!

Angry? No, not at all.
I believe he knows what he's doing.

You are going to reward me?
I appreciate your kindness.

Uh... The serious Sterk and the mischievous Tandrion,
I think you should be incompatible as fire and water...

No... Through our friendly match just now,
I have no doubt for his strength and power.

And, although he purposely acts cheeky or mischievous, he is
very concerned about Cresson and other members in private.
Wow, s, such a high... compliment!?

Otherwise, Cresson's swordsmanship wouldn't be this
good if he only relies on his own efforts.

Uh... R, really, Sterk!?
Your evaluation of me is so... high... I am so honored!!

Even the training is casual,
the members still put their hearts and souls into it.

While some knights in Arland would skip the sword training.
In comparison, the Guard is way better.

No... I am sorry, you didn't hear that from me.
Alright, let's go back to the Academy.

Ah, okay~! Hmm... Maybe Arland
is a very peaceful country, huh?
